name: Sim Junta
description: Sim Junta – A game of dirty politics! You are the new dictator of Risuena, a small and poor country of the third world. You have just seized power after a bloody coup and your intentions are to stay in power as long as you can, to rip this country off, transfer the money to your secret Swiss bank account and of course, stay alive and...
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Win 7, Win 8 Memory: 1 GB RAM Storage: 350 MB available space Additional Notes: Minimum 1366x768 screen resolution

reviews.review_text: Fun game for the first minutes, then it's a bit boring and hard even in easy!  5/10

Minimalist, and the game window sometimes freezes and doesn’t cooperate with swtiching to another program. This is mainly a puzzle game where you need to play off factions against each other until you run out of money. Contrary to what others have said, it really has nothing in common with Tropico, not even mood. I got it for less than a dollar. It’s not a rip-off, but there are better games on the Web for free.  If you’re interested in a more serious game of this type, you might look up Hidden Agenda, from 1988, which is not currently on Steam. That’s probably the “retro” game the developers were talking about.
I tried with really open eyes but this is really not a game to pay for. Simply bad.  If you're into micro management of parameters, try Democracy games, or get a job as an engineer!

I don't understand why i lost the game when i increased spending on education and healthcare. I guess developer don't support obamacare.  Game's okay, it's like playing democracy, except much simpler. Adjust taxes, spending expenses, etc. I could not save (bug) any games as saving will cause it to crash. Even when I got it at a discount of less than $5, I would still say it's only worth < $3 as there's not much aspects to it.
